text: Agnidra vinacea is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Frederic Moore in 1879. It is found in Sikkim, north-eastern India and north- eastern Myanmar. The wingspan is 17.5–21 mm for males and 19.5–23.5 mm for females. Adults are similar to Agnidra fuscilinea.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) Supplement 12 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1879 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Agnidra vinacea
